result.execSummary:
The defendant Colin L Held was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Consecutive to: ONLY Count 1 of Case 16CM635, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied - PAID IN FULL.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Anger Management or Domestic Violence Counseling and follow-through as deemed appropriate by Agent.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed. Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Cases 15TR5961, 15CT1619, 15CM556 and 16CM730 were dismissed and read in.
05/11/2017 PER MOTION HEARING, COURT AMENDS CONTACT ORDER TO: NON-VIOLENT CONTACT WITH GRANDMOTHER AND SUPERVISED BY A THIRD PARTY/ADULT FAMILY MEMBER.

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Colin L Held in court.  
Probation Agent Richard Oliciargei appeared in court.
Cases:  15CM2002, 16CM450, 16CM635 & 16CM730  All called together.
Court to Address - Defendent's Motion to lift the No Contact Condition of Probation with his Grandmother (Sentence Modification).

Grandmother appeared in court.

Defendant presented statements to the court.
Probation Agent presented statements to the court (if contact is allowed, it needs to be supervised contact with a responsible third party).
Court addressed the issue with the Grandmother - Grandmother is requesting contact with the defendant.
Grandmother presented statatments to the court.

Court Grants - Sentence Modification.
Court will Lift the No Contact Condition of Probation with his Grandmother.
Court will allow the following contact:  Non-Violent Contact with grandmother and supervised by a third party/adult family member.
AMENDED JOC TO BE PREPARED.
Motion hearing on May 11, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Prior: N95 W26715 County Line Road, Colgate, WI 53017
to Change Condition of Probation filed by defendant.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Shannon Tenney appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Colin L Held in court, in custody, with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Counts 2 & 3 are dismissed as read ins.


Court orders the following:
90 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
Consecutive to count 1 of case 16CM635.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  2 Years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Anger Management or Domestic Violence Counseling and Follow-Through as deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ;

No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victim listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA sample to be provided.

DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Apply Bail to this case and case 16CM450 and Refund Any Balance to the Posting Party.
